Description.val:
The Light Engineer Utility Trailer (LEUT) is a pintle towed light utility trailer.  The LEUT will be used across the full spectrum of military operations to include deployments and to support nation-building operations.  The LEUT will transport key construction enablers such as Skid Steer Loaders (SSL) and Backhoe Loaders (BHL).  Two types of LEUTs are required.  Type I LEUT is a 4-ton payload capacity trailer of which must be Low Velocity Air Drop (LVAD) capable.  Type II LEUT is a 10-ton payload capacity trailer.  The prime movers for the Type I and Type II LEUT are the Engineer Bradley Fighting Vehicles (EBFV), Engineer Squad Vehicles (ESV), M113 series Armored Personnel Carriers (APC), Armored Combat Earthmover (ACE), 2.5 ton cargo, 5-ton cargo, and 5, 10, and 20-ton dump trucks.  

The Army Acquisition Objective for the LEUT is 2,853 (Type I: 1,584 and Type II: 1,269).

Justification.val:
FY 2016 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $12,855 million supports the procurement of 214 Type 1 LEUTs and 180 Type II LEUTs to include government follow on testing, Production Verification Testing, manuals, Total Package Fielding contract costs, and transportation.  As of July 2014, Acquisition Strategy has changed; test articles and LRIP quantities will now include Type I trailers.  The LEUT will provide engineer units with a critically needed dedicated small equipment transport capability.  With the LEUT's ability to transport key construction enablers, the LEUT will allow future force units the ability to gain, control and sustain route access in a timely manner and effectively maintain momentum/mobility throughout the battlespace.  

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val: FY 14 funds First Article Test trailers.

OverallDeliveryScheduleRemarks.val: Production rates are monthly.FY 14 funded First Article Trailers Type I and Type II.Production of FY15 trailers will begin after First Article Test (FAT) is complete.
